pages.text: Operating artillery requires various tools to prep ammo and charges during loading.

pages.heading: Powder Charge
pages.text: The Powder Charge contains propellant used to launch any loaded ammunition.$(br)$(br)Using less or more charges will decrease or increase the launch velocity of projectiles, respectively.
The Ram Rod is used to push charges or ammunition down the barrel of an artillery piece after it has been placed inside.
The Long Match is used to fire an artillery piece after both the charge and ammunition has been loaded and the projectile rammed down.
The Gunner's Quadrant can be used via crouching near the artillery piece to change the pitch and azimuth of the shot.
